Brief description: Emails from employees at Enron organized into folders.
Preprocessing: Attachments removed, invalid email addresses converted to user@enron.com or no_address@enron.com.
Reference: Klimt, Bryan, and Yiming Yang. "Introducing the Enron Corpus." CEAS. 2004.Kossinets, Gueorgi, Jon Kleinberg, and Duncan Watts. "The structure of information pathways in a social communication network." Proceedings of the 14th ACM SIGKDD international conference on Knowledge discovery and data mining. ACM, 2008.
Creator: Klimt, B. and Y. Yang

Brief description: Corpus containing both legitimate and spam emails.
Preprocessing: Four version of the corpus involving whether or not a lemmatiser or stop-list was enabled.
Creator: Androutsopoulos, J. et al.

Reference: Almeida, Tiago A., José María G. Hidalgo, and Akebo Yamakami. "Contributions to the study of SMS spam filtering: new collection and results."Proceedings of the 11th ACM symposium on Document engineering. ACM, 2011. doi=10.1016/j.eswa.2012.02.053
Creator: T. Almeida et al.

Reference: Joachims, Thorsten. A Probabilistic Analysis of the Rocchio Algorithm with TFIDF for Text Categorization. No. CMU-CS-96-118. Carnegie-mellon univ pittsburgh pa dept of computer science, 1996.
Creator: T. Mitchell et al.

Reference: Dimitrakakis, Christos, and Samy Bengio. Online Policy Adaptation for Ensemble Algorithms. No. EPFL-REPORT-82788. IDIAP, 2002.
Creator: M. Hopkins et al.
